result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick L. McDavid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L. McDavid

records.addlTxt: of Completion submitted by Attorney Watson

3:18 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Kristyne Watson. Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:    DE was previously sentenced by this Court, though due to a mistake in entry by the clerk, DE was released early. Atty Watson requests DE be allowed to remain out, as he is currently being supervised by the DOC. Alternatively, DE requests fine instead of remaining sentence. ST objects and indicates there has been no new factor to modify the sentence. Discussion held. For reasons set forth on the record, the Court finds there is no new factor. The sentence as originally ordered shall stand. DE taken into custody to serve the remaining time on his sentence. JOC amended to reflect DE is eligible for inside work crew only.

3:27 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.   No appearance by the Defendant. Attorney Kristyn Watson appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Hearing today was scheduled because the DE was released early from his sentence. Discussion held regarding the current location of the DE. The State advises the Court that they had a writ prepared for Columbia County Jail. Court adjourns. Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Atty Kristyne Watson.
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Per Judge Gabriele, set case on for hearing re: remaining jail time to serve. 
Email to Atty Watson and DA Office. 
Copy of NOH mailed to DE /rmm
vm left for Atty Bub re DE jail time
***CJOC - 120 DAYS KCJ. NO HUBER***
Fine Due Slip - $906.00
$886 due in 90 days or 17 days KCJ w/ huber or Work Crew.
of DNA Collection at Conviction

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Attorney Christopher R. Bub in court with Defendant Patrick L. McDavid who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  DE has no conflict with proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Amended Info has been filed.  Counts 1 & 4 - Dismissed and Read In.  Counts 2 & 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice given to DE in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 2 & 3 -   Defendant is sentenced to 120 days in the Kenosha County Jail on each count.  Each count is concurrent, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 76 days.  Court costs are due in 90 days or 17 days KCJ.  Appeal Rights given.
(NOTES: Record amended on 8/1/22 correcting orginal minutes from 90 days in the KCJ to 120 days in the KCJ and huber removed as no huber was authorized)
Correspondence received from Atty Bub stating case is resolved and ready to proceed to a plea and sentencing.  Jury Status changed to a plea hearing on 7/27/22 and jury trial is canceled.

Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution. Defendant Patrick L. McDavid appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant in custody. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: Matter heard along with co-defendant case. 22CM268 (Tanisha Love ). Matter here on Defts Motion to modify bond. Arguments Heard. The defts Motion to modify bond is denied on today's date. Deft recently filed a demand for speedy trial. Trial scheduled on today's date. 8/25/22 Pre-Trial Conference removed from the Courts calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Modify Bond

Defendant Patrick L. McDavid appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness PPPD Ofc Sarai Anguiano; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Bub. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Court does not find probable cause on the felony charges bound over for trial and are dismissed without prejudice.; misdemeanor charges bound over for trial . Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:10 am.
